title: sublayer [building profile]
description: Sublayer of a building scene layer. A building scene layer is composed of an overview and the full model containing the discipline and category layers. These layer types are represented as sublayers. A sublayer may contain other layers or sublayers (i.e. `group`) to form a nested structure.  The order of the layers is inverted, meaning the first layer is on the bottom and the last layer is on the top.

id.description: Identifier for this sublayer. **If** `layerType != 'group'`, resources will be at `/layers/{bim_layer_id}/sublayers/{this.id}/...`

name.description: Layer name. **Must be unique** per building scene layer.

alias.description: Alias of the layer name. Can be empty if alias and name are identical.

discipline.description: Semantics for work discipline groups which can be used to refine the user experience.

modelName.description: A fixed string of sublayer information. Used by client applications to define specific behavior for the modelName. See [list of defined modelNames](subLayerModelName.md) for sublayers.

visibility.description: Visibility of the sublayer. Default is `true`.

isEmpty.description: Returns true if the layer has no features, false otherwise.  Only specified if ```layerType``` is ```3DObject```.

examples.title: Building Scene Layer simple group with Point sublayer
